授業目的: The purpose of this course is to improve students' communication skills, listening skills, presentation skills, and critical thinking skills through the study of international business and entrepreneurship.
到達目標:
Students will be able to:
1. Learn about the fundamentals of Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) and business
2. Discuss case studies and apply critical thinking skills
3. Evaluate a problem at work and propose a solution
4. Evaluate a company’s CSR efforts and propose a marketing plan
5. Deliver multimedia presentation(s) using business English
6. Create a professional business (marketing) plan
7. Create a professional, interesting video describing product or service benefits
授業方法: Classes are conducted face-to-face in the classroom. The online class participants will receive: online simultaneous interactive delivery during class time.

トピック.授業計画1:
A detailed lesson syllabus with be provided to students on the first day of class.
In principle, of the two lessons during the week, one will be dedicated towards group project work. The other class will focus on lectures and textbook assignments.
The project session will require students to complete 2 business cases studies. 1. Students will research a local business, analyze and identify and issue, and prepare a solution. 2. Students will research a large corporation and its corporate social responsibility goals. They will then analyze and propose new goals for the company to adopt.
トピック.授業外学習2: Work outside the class will require students to prepare textbook assignments and tasks related to the semester long project outlined above.

教科書/Required texts1: David Cotton, David Falvey, Simon Kent

成績評価Grading1: Participation (30%), Interview and resume (15%), Semester Project (55%)
